answers.answer: You'll eat food you normally dont. And will be put off food you normally love/like eating, it's normal and apart of pregnancy!!

I've not actually craved any weird food. Most of my cravings are suggestive, like restaurant commercials. I have had a lot of food aversions though. I wouldn't eat pizza, nachos, or anything that had chunky tomatoes pieces (which I really love). Now I can eat it occasionally again that I'm further along.

Yeah I crave weird non food items when my iron or vitamin D levels are low (baby powder) other than that I turn down a lot of food that I use to love like pizza, spaghetti, fried foods, salad , bbq sauce, spicy sausages , pop and energy drinks have all been no no's my whole pregnancy

Not necessarily. During my first pregnancy my big things were that I wanted to have buffalo wings kind of all the time (my husband was happy to go with me...yum!) And French fries, which of course I usually love, tasted bland and boring and kind of terrible. That was all that changed for me.Now expecting #2 and I've had no such cravings whatsoever. I've got a sweet tooth. But I've always had a sweet tooth. I can't indulge because I have gestational diabetes - but I still want it!
Not always true. I never craved for anything that I never ate before pregnancy. I did crave for food that I normally ate though. It's just different for some people.
I crave baby powder too it's been driving me nuts... but I just crave everything I been having. Two weeks I didn't want any Hardees and I love hardees
Your food aversion will disappear.I don't crave anything unusual. I mostly crave apples. And speggetti

question: Just want to know that do you crave food you don't usually eat while pregnant? I really love to eat seafood but because I'm nearly 10 weeks pregnant I don't even feel like eating seafood at all. Is this a pregnancy symptom?
title: Is it true you crave unusual food while pregnant
